\sqroot{-49}=no solution
3rd root of -8 = -2
you can have an odd root of a negative number, but not an even root
\sqroot{ab} = sqroot{a}*\sqroot{b}
\sqroot{a/b}=\sqroot{a}/\sqroot{b}
\sqroot{a^n}=(\sqroot{a})^n
3rd root of 8^5 = 32

a^(1/n) = nth root of a
a^(m/n) = (nth power of a)^m
a^(-m/n)= 1/a^(m/n)

## How to add radicals

\sqroot{a} + \sqroot{a} = 2\sqroot{a}
